alert.note: Alert for Page (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 10:12PM CDT until June 08 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Flood Advisory for... Central Page County in southwestern Iowa... * Until 115 AM CDT. * At 1010 PM CDT, local fire department reported heavy rain between Essex and Hepburn that will cause minor flooding. Up to one inch of rain has already fallen in a very short amount of time. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarinda, Shenandoah, Essex, Coin, Shambaugh, Yorktown and Hepburn.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
